pullRequest.title: Add stable-7 commits to api-8
pullRequest.bodyText:
Haven't checked everything but this is a start. I'm opening a wip PR because it's not finished but what's pushed can be reviewed.
Now for the fun part
There are:
missing commits from api-8 history which can be cherry-picked (this PR)
missing commits from api-8 history which cannot be cherry-picked (the old api has been nuked, command api is a good example of this). This means bugs fixed by those commits needs to be retested on the new API (out of scope for this PR)
missing commits from api-8 history which cannot be cherry-picked because their classes are missing (read this as "the world API is gone, reduced to atoms")
Be more specific!
c154fd4
bb14b83
bd284c2
4e17b0a
96bb9d1
f12f8e7
But wait, there's more
85a951a
That commit was not completely cherry-picked.
ChangeLevelEvent is deprecated on api7, but perfectly fine on api8 (fixed in this PR)
ChangeEntityExperienceEvent has all of its int-based methods deprecated in favour of Data-based one on api-7, but no deprecation or data methods on api8. What's more, that event is now screwed because there's no ExperienceHolderData in api8 so it cannot be cherry-picked.

commit.message:
Ensure that an exact match is always returned alone.

Also added unit tests

Fixes #2566
Fix Account#getBalance javadoc returning the wrong result

Merge SerializationBehaviors.METADATA_ONLY addition. Merges #2084

Signed-off-by: Gabriel Harris-Rouquette <gabizou@me.com>

Fix completion with allOf element

Fixes #2126

Only add child command arguments to context if there are any

Fixes #2128

Add select and whilst to BlockRay

Add new functions to replace stopFilter and skipFilter

These functions have been deprecated and replaced with whilst and select, along with clearer javadocs.
Use non-deprecated methods from BlockRay, ensure that a hit is selected

Add simple Placeholder system

This enables plugins to register their own PlaceholderParsers to the Sponge registry, enabling plugins to provide and access placeholders without needing a third party plugin.

Notably, this PR does NOT include a templating system. This is intentional, to allow plugins to provide their own systems as now.

Part of the ideas from #1891

beforeCommit.message: Move placeholder API outside text package

commit.message:
Revert "Bump guice version to 4.2.3 (#2123)"

This reverts commit 712c42d9e5dfc53fed6da9767b930978a1c119e4.

Add defined flags to CommandContext (#2033)

* Allow context to track defined flags for complex flag parsing, such as with optional values.
* Include flags in context snapshot, add flag to context after parsing, and delegate to valueElement for completion when present.
* Inline MARK_TRUE_FUNC

nodes.bodyText: Should turn into Suppliers, DummyObjectProvider is gonna be nuked.

commit.message: text: Support reading DataContainer text format from Configurate (#2198)
Deprecate unused elements of the KickPlayerEvent

IN NO EVENT SHALL THE + * AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER + * LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, + * OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN + * THE SOFTWARE. + */ +package org.spongepowered.api.text.placeholder; + +import net.kyori.adventure.text.Component; +import net.kyori.adventure.text.ComponentLike; +import net.kyori.adventure.text.TextComponent; +import org.checkerframework.checker.nullness.qual.NonNull; +import org.spongepowered.api.Sponge; +import org.spongepowered.api.util.ResettableBuilder; + +/** + * A {@link ComponentLike} that can be used in {@link Component} building methods + * that represents a placeholder in text. + * + *

A {@link PlaceholderText} is the collection of a {@link PlaceholderParser} + * along with contextual data in the supplied {@link PlaceholderContext}, + * enabling its use in a {@link TextComponent} object.

+ * + *

Such placeholders will generally be built from tokenized strings, however + * these objects make no assumption about the format of text templating. Such a + * system can therefore be used by other templating engines without conforming + * to a particular standard.

+ * + *

The {@link PlaceholderContext} is fixed when this object is created, but + * {@link PlaceholderParser#parse(PlaceholderContext)} is not called until + * {@link #asComponent()} is called. Thus, any {@link TextComponent} object that is created + * will reflect the time that the {@link TextComponent} object was requested, and not when + * this object itself was created. It therefore follows that implementations must + * not cache the result of {@link #asComponent()} unless it is known that the supplied + * parser is not sensitive to the time of invocation.

+ */ +public interface PlaceholderText extends ComponentLike {
